66129.message: My colleague was just tricked. EPAM did that for a while. Just to make it hard for him to change jobs because with a blue card, you can just stand up and leave. And nothing in the legal field will stop you. After 18 months of work, you don‚Äôt even need permission; you just go and start at a new job. Permission, if needed, takes a couple of weeks even before 18 months, just to renew the decision. I did that. They don‚Äôt even change the card, by the way, just some fuss and a couple of hundred zlotys from the company.

66132.message: But with a national visa, this won‚Äôt work. You‚Äôll have to start the process all over again, which is long, noticeably more expensive, and you can only stay in the country for two weeks without an active work contract (with a blue card ‚Äî 3 months).

66133.message: Nope, not always a couple of weeks. It really depends on the voivodeship. I waited three months.

66134.message: Officially it‚Äôs a couple of weeks. The voivodeship doesn‚Äôt have the right to extend the deadlines. You can wait as long as you want only when you‚Äôve submitted the documents and are awaiting a decision from the administration.

66135.message: When I changed jobs, I consulted, and they told me there was a two-week window before and after the job change. You just fill out a form, provide a new contract, and a statement from the previous job ‚Äî that‚Äôs it, no need to reissue the card, it's just a notification process.

66136.message: You‚Äôre probably talking about the residence permit. Yes, they stamp it. In general, I waited three months for the work permit and a year for the blue card. And with each passing year, the number of people wanting the card increases, so does the wait time.

66137.message: Everything I wrote earlier was about the national residence permit, not the blue card.

66138.message: The notification procedure for the blue card kicks in after 18 months from the first card issuance. Well, not the issuance, but the start date of its validity.

66139.message: I went through all this myself, I‚Äôm on my second card now, received it at the start of the month. It took a long time, yes, I submitted in early December. My wife still hasn‚Äôt received hers. I‚Äôve got a blue card.

66141.message: It is, but due to COVID, they‚Äôre handling things chaotically now. Last time, we got them together.

66147.message: What kind of nonsense is that? Under what conditions?

66148.message: Well, you sign an agreement for the payments (usually there‚Äôs a total amount that, according to the agreement, is proportionally paid over N months) like a loan. If you don‚Äôt leave the company during the payments, the amount is yours (the debt is canceled), but if you quit, you have to return everything they‚Äôve paid you up to that point.

66150.message: I think it‚Äôs unfair ‚Äî I‚Äôve already spent the relocation money, why should I return it if they fire me?

66151.message: No, relocation is at least understandable. But this was purely about a salary increase. The conversation was like, "Give me a raise" ‚Äî "We can't raise your salary, but we can do this."

66153.message: If they fire you, you don‚Äôt have to. There‚Äôs a clause about "termination on your side."

66186.message: In fact, you can apply for a green card from the first day of work, officially. They make up stories like, ‚ÄúYou need to work a year first, then the process takes another two, and then maybe we‚Äôll do it.‚Äù The worst part is that the transfer from L to a green card is only possible at the company‚Äôs request, you can‚Äôt initiate it yourself.

66213.message: Unfortunately, those in the know will understand.

66214.message: Here‚Äôs an example: A prenuptial agreement can be declared invalid if it infringes on the rights of one of the parties. After 15 years, a split, 2 apartments (which were owned before the marriage and resold), and the second half gets nothing. The court: The rights were infringed because one party could have had an apartment, so the court says, OK, and that‚Äôs it :)

66215.message: Well, for example, my wife wouldn‚Äôt have been able to join me now if we hadn‚Äôt officially registered our marriage.

66217.message: That's how the prenup can be declared invalid.

66220.message: > 3. A prenuptial agreement cannot limit the legal capacity or capacity to act of the spouses, their right to seek protection of their rights in court; regulate personal non-property relations between spouses, the rights and duties of spouses in relation to children; provide for conditions limiting the right of an incapacitated, needy spouse to receive maintenance; include other conditions that put one of the spouses in an extremely unfavorable position or contradict the basic principles of family law.

66222.message: > In practice, an unequal division of property by itself is not a ground for declaring a prenuptial agreement invalid.

66223.message: Yeah, so all the property acquired is the property of the person it's registered to, and when they divorce, the wife is left with the kids and no housing ‚Äî this clause put her in that situation.

66224.message: > The court can issue a decision to dismiss the claim even when the only property acquired during the marriage passes to one party without any compensation. For example, if the only apartment (in the absence of other property) goes to one spouse under the terms of the agreement, the court dismissed the claim to invalidate the contract.

66225.message: Keep that in mind before you start thinking about it.

66226.message: Agreed :) But when you‚Äôre getting ready, make sure to find out everything beforehand, as I would advise a close friend.

66264.message: Portugal is actually winning the war on drugs not through bans and killings (see Philippines) but through sensible decriminalization and the introduction of substitution therapy (plus other non-violent measures).

66267.message: Thanks, I need to talk to them. I think I know plenty of people there :)

66268.message: Maybe it would be better if heroin junkies blocked your path, threatening with a knife, right?

66269.message: Well, I‚Äôm not trying to start a flame war. I‚Äôm just saying it‚Äôs annoying. In Spain, by the way, this doesn‚Äôt happen, even though they‚Äôre neighbors. Everything is probably thriving there too, but you have to look for it yourself. And nobody clings to you üôÇ

66270.message: Portugal is a small and poor country by European standards. Considerably poorer than even Spain. And they had a very bad drug situation. They fought it the American way, by banning and crushing, and SURPRISE ‚Äî it didn‚Äôt help. Then some people realized that ‚Äúthis is not a coincidence,‚Äù and they changed the policy to a more tolerant one. And it turned out to be very effective. But the journey isn‚Äôt over, so you‚Äôll still find remnants.

66271.message: And I‚Äôve also heard a lot of stories about European cities where ‚ÄúAfrican pushers‚Äù block the way. And just as many stories from those same cities from people who didn‚Äôt encounter anything like that. Maybe you just had bad luck with the time or place and projected that experience onto the whole country.

66272.message: Well, I drove through half of Spain and Portugal with stops in major cities, so the sample is quite representative. It wasn‚Äôt just a case of walking around during a layover for an hour. And again, I don‚Äôt really fit the Mediterranean type; in Scandinavia, I‚Äôm always taken for a local and they try all the regional languages before switching to English :). And we‚Äôve already figured out that Portugal hasn‚Äôt delivered anything special yet, so there‚Äôs no interest. Sorry if I touched on some flame war topic, I didn‚Äôt mean to üôÇ

It‚Äôs an absolutely normal trend ‚Äî increasing abstraction in work. Nocode is progressing by leaps and bounds, new tools are appearing.
It‚Äôs what happens in any field ‚Äî it used to be normal to draw on the floor, not in AutoCAD. There are still many old-timers saying, ‚Äúyour programs... I‚Äôll draw it by hand in 15 minutes.‚Äù People cling to what they know and are afraid of losing control or stepping out of their comfort zone.

66320.message: I just finished writing a letter for Samat and Fedya, it took a lot of time to describe the mess I got into. 2 systems that weren‚Äôt finished in 8 months. And one that works, but with the wrong architecture.

66321.message:

66332.message: You have a mid-level product and need custom development, you can use a ready-made UI, but the ready-made solution will cover 7% of the tasks and may be a patchwork of crutches.

66336.message: Is this outsourced or your team?

66340.message:
I may be exaggerating, but Stripe integration should take a mid-level dev about a week (including tests).
We had a cool case in one app where one group of clients paid, and we gave another group of clients the money, so there was an intermediate account in Stripe for accumulating funds and for paying out to the contractors.
